intro: Ammannia multiflora f. decipiens, commonly known as the false ammannia, is a flowering plant in the family Nychthemeraliaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This fern-like plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
